articles.content:
Special information bulletin published 
    Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association published a special information bulletin on the occasion of the 9th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
 In an article titled "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung Will Always Be Remembered By The People" the bulletin said that the demise of the president, the greatest leader of the Korean people and the world progressives and a distinguished revolutionary, was a big loss not only to the Korean people but to all the progressive people in the world. 
 The president led the arduous anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory to achieve liberation of the country, enabled the Korean people to emerge the most proud and strongest people in the world and built the DPRK into a beautiful and developing powerful socialist country on debris after the war, it noted.    
 In another article titled "Mansu Hill pervaded with reverence for President Kim Il Sung" the bulletin said: Thousands of people from the DPRK and different other countries and regions visit his statue on Mansu Hill in Pyongyang every day to pay tribute to him. He will always be remembered by the Korean people and the world progressives.

articles.content:
North side's delegation leaves for Seoul
    Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The north side's delegation led by Kim Ryong Song, chief councillor of the DPRK cabinet, left here today to participate in the 11th inter-Korean ministerial talks to be held in Seoul.
 It was seen off at the airport by Minister of Culture Kang Nung Su, director of the secretariat of the committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland An Kyong Ho, first vice-chairman of the state planning commission Pak Chang Ryon who is chairman of the north side of the north-south committee for the promotion of economic cooperation and officials concerned.
